pullRequest.body:
Adds various results on takeUntil. 
In preparation for a proof of Tutte's theorem. 

Split off the section on walk decompositions to a new file, because `Walk.lean` was getting too long.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

- [ ] depends on: #21981

[Zulip thread on Tutte's](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Tutte's.20theorem)

### PR summary [219e62991b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21250/commits/219e62991bebe999519a7dec02c8ef84b28a399e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>32 files</summary> `Mathlib.Combinatorics.Additive.Corner.Roth` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.Extremal.RuzsaSzemeredi` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Acyclic` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.AdjMatrix` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Circulant` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Clique` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Coloring` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.ConcreteColorings` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Connectivity.Represents` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Connectivity.Subgraph` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Connectivity.WalkCounting` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Diam` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Ends.Defs` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Ends.Properties` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Girth` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Hamiltonian` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Hasse` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.LapMatrix` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Matching` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Metric` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Partition` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Path` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Prod` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.StronglyRegular` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Sum` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Trails` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Triangle.Basic` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Triangle.Counting` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Triangle.Removal` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Triangle.Tripartite` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Turan` `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.UniversalVerts`</details>|1|
| `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Connectivity.WalkDecomp` (new file)|535|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsCycle.isPath_of_append_left`
`+ IsCycle.isPath_of_append_right`
`+ IsCycle.isPath_takeUntil`
`+ Nil.append`
`+ end_mem_tail_support`
`+ endpoint_not_mem_support_takeUntil`
`+ getVert_takeUntil`
`+ length_takeUntil_lt`
`+ mem_support_of_adj_toSubgraph`
`+ nil_append_iff`
`+ nil_takeUntil`
`+ not_mem_support_takeUntil_takeUntil`
`+ snd_takeUntil`
`+ takeUntil_cons`
`+ takeUntil_first`
`+ takeUntil_takeUntil`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

@YaelDillies Backmerging master put `Walk.lean` over the line limit, so I took the liberty of splitting off the section on takeUntil, dropUntil and rotate into `WalkDecomp.lean`. I'm happy to revert this if we don't want to do it in this PR, but splitting it was fairly painless. I think it does make sense to do it now, since it was also the section I was heavily editing.

For the ease of maintainer review: [diff to master before the split](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/master...5d6a59312fbaeb0f742d808cfb4b86b865eee07f), [diff of the refactoring](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/5d6a59312fbaeb0f742d808cfb4b86b865eee07f...135a8a4f963bec42d38b4aeef776b1984fd4ed1a)

> Indeed it would be better if you could make the move in a quick preliminary PR

Done: #21981

This PR/issue depends on:
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#21981
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Indeed it would be better if you could make the move in a quick preliminary PR

Thanks!

maintainer delegate
Indeed it would be better if you could make the move in a quick preliminary PR

```suggestion
lemma not_adj_toSubgraph_takeUntil_takeUntil [DecidableEq V] {u v w : V} {p : G.Walk u u}
    (hp : p.IsCycle) (hv : v ∈ p.support) (hw : w ∈ (p.takeUntil v hv).support) :
```
Isn't `(p.takeUntil v hv).takeUntil w hw` the same thing as `p.takeUntil w hw'`?
No, this is basically "the path you get until you encounter v or w, whichever comes first"
Really? Unless I'm misunderstanding, `hw` says you re encountering `w` before `v`
Oh, yeah, that's right. That might even simplify the place where I'm using this, so I'll go back there and reevaluate if this is needed/the right formulation.

I have removed this in favour of the results in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21250/commits/fcd36373da80465bc5ab1c2f5508cca0cc36c641. [This](https://github.com/pimotte/TutteLean/blob/62c3bbc0429c5659e9d1212e4fbb83e4f608d67b/TutteLean/Part2.lean#L518) is the result I have that uses these.

```suggestion
  obtain ⟨n, hn, hnl⟩ := mem_support_iff_exists_getVert.mp (mem_support_of_adj_toSubgraph' _ h)
```

```suggestion
lemma IsCycle.isPath_of_append_right {p : G.Walk u v} {q : G.Walk v u} (h : ¬ p.IsNil)
```
is enough, right?

```suggestion
    (c.takeUntil w h).IsPath := by
```

```suggestion
lemma IsCycle.isPath_takeUntil {c : G.Walk v v} (hc : c.IsCycle) (h : w ∈ c.support) :
```

```suggestion
lemma snd_takeUntil {p : G.Walk u v} (hsu : w ≠ u) (h : w ∈ p.support) :
```

```suggestion
lemma length_takeUntil_lt {u v w : V} {p : G.Walk v w} (h : u ∈ p.support) (huw : u ≠ w) :
```

```suggestion
lemma getVert_takeUntil {u v : V} {n : ℕ} {p : G.Walk u v} (hw : w ∈ p.support)
```

```suggestion
lemma takeUntil_first (p : G.Walk u v) :
    p.takeUntil u some_lemma_here = .nil := by cases p <;> simp [Walk.takeUntil]
```

```suggestion
lemma mem_support_of_adj_toSubgraph {u v u' v' : V} {p : G.Walk u v} (hp : p.toSubgraph.Adj u' v') :
```

```suggestion
lemma nil_append {p : G.Walk u v} {q : G.Walk v w} : (p.append q).Nil ↔ p.Nil ∧ q.Nil := by
```
and maybe you can also prove `Nil.append`
Not adopted, conflicts with `nil.append p = p` lemma, did add Nil.append.

```suggestion
theorem end_mem_tail_support {u v : V} {p : G.Walk u v} (h : ¬ p.Nil) : v ∈ p.support.tail :=
```

```suggestion
    (hadj : G.Adj u v) :
    (p.cons hadj).takeUntil w (List.mem_of_mem_tail hwp) = (p.takeUntil w hwp).cons hadj := by
```
is arguably a bit better. Same below

```suggestion
lemma nil_takeUntil {p : G.Walk u v} (hwp : w ∈ p.support) :
```

Sorry, I previously missuggested. Since `h` can be inferred from the LHS, `p` should be explicit so that you can do `rw [snd_takeUntil hsu p]`
```suggestion
lemma snd_takeUntil (hsu : w ≠ u) (p : G.Walk u v) (h : w ∈ p.support) :
```

Manually adopted:)

Do you know if these kind of things (order, implicit/explicit, optional arguments, conditional simp lemma's) are documented somewhere?
It's partly documented (see the style guide), but it's still mostly in my head. Working on it 🛠️

Similarly,
```suggestion
lemma takeUntil_takeUntil (p : G.Walk u v) (w x : V) (hw : w ∈ p.support)
```
This one stays as is because it's not a rewriting lemma

```suggestion
lemma takeUntil_cons {v' : V} {p : G.Walk v' v} (hwp : w ∈ p.support) (h : u ≠ w)
```

```suggestion
      hx \t Walk.nil
```

```suggestion
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): takeUntil properties
